verses.verse: Then Samson <S%H8123><s%> went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to Timnah <S%H8553><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> a woman <S%H802><s%> in Timnah, <S%H8553><s%> [one] of the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of the Philistines. <S%H6430><s%>

So he came <S%H5927><s%> back <S%H5927><s%> and told <S%H5046><s%> his father and mother, <S%H1><s%> "I saw <S%H517><s%> a woman <S%H7200><s%> in Timnah, <S%H802><s%> [one] of the daughters <S%H8553><s%> of the Philistines; <S%H1323><s%> now <S%H6430><s%> therefore, get <S%H6258><s%> her for me as a wife. <S%H3947><s%>"

Then his father and his mother <S%H1><s%> said <S%H517><s%> to him, "Is there <S%H559><s%> no <S%H369><s%> woman <S%H369><s%> among the daughters <S%H802><s%> of your relatives, <S%H1323><s%> or among all <S%H251><s%> our people, <S%H3605><s%> that you go <S%H5971><s%> to take <S%H1980><s%> a wife <S%H3947><s%> from the uncircumcised <S%H802><s%> Philistines <S%H6189><s%>?" But Samson <S%H6430><s%> said <S%H8123><s%> to his father, "Get <S%H559><s%> her for me, for she looks <S%H1><s%> <S%H3947><s%> good <S%H3474><s%> to me."

However, his father and mother <S%H1><s%> did not know <S%H517><s%> that it was of the Lord, <S%H3045><s%> for He was seeking <S%H3068><s%> an occasion <S%H1245><s%> against <S%H9637><s%> the Philistines. <S%H4480><s%> Now at that time <S%H6430><s%> the Philistines <S%H6256><s%> were ruling <S%H6430><s%> over Israel. <S%H4910><s%>

Then Samson <S%H8123><s%> went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to Timnah <S%H8553><s%> with his father and mother, <S%H1><s%> and came <S%H517><s%> as far <S%H935><s%> as the vineyards <S%H5704><s%> of Timnah; <S%H3754><s%> and behold, <S%H8553><s%> a young <S%H2009><s%> lion <S%H3715><s%> [came] roaring <S%H738><s%> toward <S%H7580><s%> him.

And the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H9484><s%> upon him mightily, <S%H9484><s%> so that he tore <S%H8156><s%> him as one tears <S%H8156><s%> a kid <S%H1423><s%> though he had <S%H369><s%> nothing <S%H3972><s%> <S%H369><s%> in his hand; <S%H3027><s%> but he did not tell <S%H5046><s%> his father or mother <S%H1><s%> what <S%H517><s%> he had done. <S%H834><s%>
So he went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> and talked <S%H1696><s%> to the woman; <S%H802><s%> and she looked <S%H3474><s%> <S%H5869><s%> good <S%H3474><s%> to Samson. <S%H8123><s%>

When he returned <S%H7725><s%> later <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3117><s%> to take <S%H3947><s%> her, he turned <S%H5493><s%> aside <S%H5493><s%> to look <S%H7200><s%> at the carcass <S%H4658><s%> of the lion; <S%H9030><s%> and behold, <S%H2009><s%> a swarm <S%H5712><s%> of bees <S%H1682><s%> and honey <S%H1706><s%> were in the body <S%H1472><s%> of the lion. <S%H9030><s%>

So he scraped <S%H9544><s%> the honey into his hands <S%H3709><s%> and went <S%H1980><s%> on, eating <S%H398><s%> as he went. <S%H1980><s%> When he came <S%H1980><s%> to his father and mother, <S%H1><s%> he gave <S%H517><s%> [some] to them and they ate <S%H5414><s%> [it;] but he did not tell <S%H398><s%> them that he had scraped <S%H5046><s%> the honey <S%H9544><s%> out of the body <S%H1706><s%> of the lion. <S%H1472><s%>

Then his father went <S%H1><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the woman; <S%H3381><s%> and Samson <S%H802><s%> made <S%H8123><s%> a feast <S%H6213><s%> there, <S%H4960><s%> for the young <S%H8033><s%> men <S%H970><s%> customarily did <S%H970><s%> this. <S%H6213><s%>
And it came <S%H1961><s%> about when they saw <S%H7200><s%> him that they brought <S%H3947><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> companions <S%H4828><s%> to be with him.

Then Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, "Let me now <S%H4994><s%> propound <S%H2330><s%> a riddle <S%H2420><s%> to you; if <S%H518><s%> you will indeed <S%H5046><s%> tell <S%H5046><s%> it to me within the seven <S%H7651><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> of the feast, <S%H4960><s%> and find <S%H4672><s%> it out, then I will give <S%H5414><s%> you thirty <S%H7970><s%> linen <S%H5466><s%> wraps <S%H5466><s%> and thirty <S%H7970><s%> changes <S%H2487><s%> of clothes. <S%H899><s%>

"But if <S%H518><s%> you are unable <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3201><s%> to tell <S%H5046><s%> me, then you shall give <S%H5414><s%> me thirty <S%H7970><s%> linen <S%H5466><s%> wraps <S%H5466><s%> and thirty <S%H7970><s%> changes <S%H2487><s%> of clothes. <S%H899><s%>" And they said <S%H559><s%> to him, "Propound <S%H2330><s%> your riddle, <S%H2420><s%> that we may hear <S%H8085><s%> it."

So he said <S%H559><s%> to them, "Out of the eater <S%H398><s%> came <S%H3318><s%> something <S%H3978><s%> to eat, <S%H3978><s%> And out of the strong <S%H5794><s%> came <S%H3318><s%> something <S%H4966><s%> sweet. <S%H4966><s%>" But they could <S%H3201><s%> not tell <S%H5046><s%> the riddle <S%H2420><s%> in three <S%H7969><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>

Then it came <S%H1961><s%> about on the fourth <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> that they said <S%H559><s%> to Samson's wife, <S%H802><s%> "Entice <S%H6601><s%> your husband, <S%H376><s%> that he may tell <S%H5046><s%> us the riddle, <S%H2420><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> we burn <S%H8313><s%> you and your father's house <S%H1004><s%> with fire. <S%H784><s%> Have you invited <S%H7121><s%> us to impoverish <S%H3423><s%> us? Is this not [so?]"

And Samson's wife <S%H802><s%> wept <S%H1058><s%> before <S%H5921><s%> him and said, <S%H559><s%> "You only <S%H7534><s%> hate <S%H8130><s%> me, and you do not love <S%H157><s%> me; you have propounded <S%H2330><s%> a riddle <S%H2420><s%> to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of my people, <S%H5971><s%> and have not told <S%H5046><s%> [it] to me." And he said <S%H559><s%> to her, "Behold, <S%H2009><s%> I have not told <S%H5046><s%> [it] to my father or mother; <S%H1><s%> so should I tell <S%H517><s%> you?"

However she wept <S%H1058><s%> before <S%H5921><s%> him seven <S%H7651><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> while <S%H834><s%> their feast <S%H4960><s%> lasted. <S%H1961><s%> And it came <S%H1961><s%> about on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> that he told <S%H5046><s%> her because <S%H3588><s%> she pressed <S%H6693><s%> him so hard. <S%H6693><s%> She then told <S%H5046><s%> the riddle <S%H2420><s%> to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of her people. <S%H5971><s%>

So the men <S%H376><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> before <S%H2962><s%> the sun <S%H2775><s%> went <S%H935><s%> down, "What <S%H4100><s%> is sweeter <S%H4966><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> honey <S%H1706><s%>? And what <S%H4100><s%> is stronger <S%H5794><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> a lion <S%H738><s%>?" And he said <S%H559><s%> to them, "If <S%H3884><s%> you had not plowed <S%H9177><s%> with my heifer, <S%H5697><s%> You would not have found <S%H4672><s%> out my riddle. <S%H2420><s%>"

Then the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H9484><s%> upon him mightily, <S%H9484><s%> and he went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to Ashkelon <S%H831><s%> and killed <S%H5221><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> of them and took <S%H3947><s%> their spoil, <S%H2488><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> the changes <S%H2487><s%> [of clothes] to those who told <S%H5046><s%> the riddle. <S%H2420><s%> And his anger <S%H639><s%> burned, <S%H2734><s%> and he went <S%H5927><s%> up to his father's house. <S%H1004><s%>
But Samson's wife <S%H802><s%> was [given] to his companion <S%H4828><s%> who <S%H834><s%> had been his friend. <S%H9566><s%>
